ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, Astronomy majors should definitely consider taking this course. It's a very good introduction to the topic, and because it doesn't assume GR, it can be taken before or after GR.
Absolutely. Anyone with any type of interest in cosmology should take this course, assuming they're prepared with the appropriate background in math and physics.
This course surveyed the important topics in modern cosmology.Yes. It was interesting and provided me with a solid background in the field.
I would recommend the class as a good introduction to the field.
I recommend to audit this class instead of actually taking if students are interested in cosmology and if Prof. Natarajan teaches this class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course gave me a foundation in Cosmology which will be useful throughout my career. At the end of the course the instructor gave us an assignment to write a paper on a recent cosmology journal article. This exercise (as intended) showed me that I can read and understand the frontiers of research in this area.The course also helped me to put my research in a larger context.Thank you!
I have become interested in recent work in the field and may pursue a short project to learn more.
